title: Vinnie Jones vows to give the proceeds of X Factor recording contract to charity
text:
Vinnie Jones has vowed to give the proceeds of a potential recording contract to charity if he wins the celebrity version of the X Factor.

The actor, 54, who has returned to the show after pulling out following the death of his wife Tanya, said he will give the money to Harefield hospital and Cedars Sinai - both of which previously treated his late wife.

Vinnie lost Tanya, his wife of 25 years, to cancer in July earlier this year after a six-year battle with the disease.

Sweet gesture: Vinnie Jones has vowed to give the proceeds of a potential recording contract to charity if he wins the celebrity version of the X Factor

Following the announcement on Saturday that Vinnie will still take part in the show, Vinnie took to Twitter to reveal what he would do the prize money.

He penned: 'I've decided any proceeds of a record contract from X-factor will go to Harefield hospital and Cedars Sinai. NOW i'm ready to Rock n Roll #CelebrityXFactor'

Many of Vinnie's followers took to the comments section of his post to wish him good luck for the upcoming live finals which will kick off on Saturday.

Tanya was rushed to Harefield aged 21 where she waited six-weeks for a heart transplant before eventually undergoing the 11-hour operation.

Charity: The actor, 54, who has returned to the show after pulling out following the death of his wife Tanya (right), said he will give the money to Harefield hospital and Cedars Sinai

Kind: Following the announcement on Saturday that Vinnie will still take part in the show, Vinnie took to Twitter to reveal what he would do the prize money

Vinnie previously told the Express in 2010: 'Harefield is much more precious to us than Hollywood. Tanya's got huge affection for the hospital and thinks so much of everyone there. For us they aren't doctors and nurses, they're angels.'

In the days before her death, Tanya was treated at Cedars Sinai Hospital in Los Angeles before spending her last hours in the couple's s home.

Vinnie was sent thorough to the X Factor: Celebrity live finals despite being absent from the audition stages after he pulled out for 'personal reasons'.

During Saturday's episode of show ahead of the announcement about who had made it through in the Overs category, Simon revealed Vinnie would still take part.

The music mogul rang him and asked if he would still be willing to feature in the live episodes of the show and he said 'yes'.

Simon told him: 'We'd love you to be on the live shows this year, we'd welcome you and give you all the help you need.'

Vinnie responded by telling him that he would be 'honoured' to appear on the show because his wife had encouraged him to compete before she tragically passed.

When asked by Simon how his family were doing, Vinnie said: 'My daughter is fantastic, she's been strong, it's really brought us closer together.

He penned: 'I've decided any proceeds of a record contract from X-factor will go to Harefield hospital and Cedars Sinai. NOW i'm ready to Rock n Roll #CelebrityXFactor'

'We are just getting through it, you just learn to carry the grief really Simon. Well Tan's pushed me really Simon, we knew it was all going on, and I put it to the family and Tan was very excited about it.'

Earlier in the show host Dermot O'Leary announced that Vinnie wasn't there due to 'personal reasons', and it was unclear whether he would be returning.

Vinnie lost Tanya, his wife of 25 years, to cancer in July after a six-year battle with the disease.

Triumphant return: During Saturday's episode of show ahead of the announcement of who had made it through in the Overs category, Simon revealed Vinnie would still take part

During a recent interview Vinnie likened being told she was dying to 'being hit by a sledgehammer' and revealed he slept by her side every night she was in hospital.

In 2013, he revealed both he and Tanya had melanoma, the most serious type of skin cancer, and he was later given the all-clear.

Tanya had also been treated twice for cervical cancer and underwent a heart transplant at 21 following the birth of her daughter Kaley.

The couple met 25 years ago while Vinnie played for AFC Wimbledon, where he and a group of players earned notoriety as a members of the 'Crazy Gang' at the club.

They married in Watford in 1994 and renewed their vows in 2007.

The X Factor: Celebrity' will return next Saturday at 8pm
